dmca.title: www.gamebugsucks.com bad legal stuff
dmca.body:
nc 

-----Original Message-----
From: bugs@gamebugs.org [mailto:bugs@gamebugs.org] 
Sent: Tuesday, May 10, 2005 4:58 PM
To: legal@theplanet.com
Subject: www.gamebugsucks.com bad legal stuff

Hello there,

My name is Bill Weaver and I am one of the owners of www.gamebugs.org. 
We are a PC Gaming site. We charge $19.95 a year for people to have access
to our site and private forums. Our site is getting rather popular, and I'm
quite happy about that. Unfortunately while being popular on the internet,
also attracts attention from hacks and other bad guys.


I have been informed that some people posting in this famous hacker site:

http://www.blizzhackers.com/viewtopic.php?t=288767&postdays=0&postorder=asc&
start=0
Have purchased www.gamebugsucks.com through your service and have indexed
our site (copied all files on our website) and are planning to release most
of our copyrighted information on this new www.gamebugsucks.com site hosted
by your company.

Now usually I don't like things to get to legal, and all of that as it
causes a big hassle for everyone, but indexing my site, creating a website
that is mysitesucks.com of course raises an alarm with me. 
Apparently they are just waiting for your host to do the 24 hour thing that
all hosts do, then will upload the indexed files and/or information onto
that new site, hosted by you.

I was hoping you could stop them quickly. There is more than enough proof
here:

http://www.blizzhackers.com/viewtopic.php?t=288767&postdays=0&postorder=asc&
start=0

If you would look at those 3 or 4 pages of posts 1 person is defending my
site, while 2 or 3 others brag about indexing the site, creating
www.gamebugsucks.com hosted by you and will upload the information "asap".

I've heard that your company deals with these types of people quickly. 
They may have already done damages to my company by their actions already,
but when they do copy this stuff over that is on my subscription based site,
it will damage me more than I am willing to "look the other way" about.

If you could email me back telling me what has been done I would be very
grateful.

Thank you.
